column4: hi can someone help. after booting /boot is not mounted. no problems with the system but for example a kernel update would not work what do I have to edit to mount /boot at boottime? (ubuntu breezy 2.6.12-9-386)
but I know it is on /dev/hde1 and i can mount in manually - will paste wait
you have no /boot entry in /etc/fstab.. so mounting manually should look like: "mount /dev/hde1 /boot"
yes manually works did that already but how to do it automatically?
ok, ubuntu is using LVM, the new entry line in /etc/fstab should look like "/dev/mapper/Ubuntu-boot     /boot      etc...."
should I try that - should make no problems if buggy line or?
no seriously, if you do not change the other lines, it should be ok and skip it in case of error.
so if the boot partition in not in LVM, then enter "/dev/hde1" directly.
I think that was my fault. will never put boot into lvm again....

...worked - (a simple line /dev/hde1 /boot did it) - anyhow both 64 and 32 bit versions of ubuntu 5.10 do forget about putting /boot in fstab when using lvm on full drive and create an invalid line in fstab
